Author: LolitaJane
Text: When I was in the absolute best shape and healthiest condition of my life, I was eating 6-8 eggs for dinner every day (for about a year), plus vegetables

Author: livipup
Text: The only reason I can think of to not eat that many eggs is the cholesterol, but I've heard that to a certain point your body will just produce less cholesterol of it's own to balance out what you eat, so maybe eating eggs every day is fine. Probably not eating over a dozen eggs though. I feel like at that point you might just be eating way too much cholesterol. With just two eggs though, that sounds like it would be an amazing deal. At the very least it would be more filling than similarly priced/similar calories meals you can buy at a lot of places.
